member.summary: This class represents an ARJ archive file.

Only the following compression methods are supported: MethodExplanation
0Uncompressed
1Combination of LZ77 and adaptive Huffman coding. Best ratio.
2Combination of LZ77 and adaptive Huffman coding.
3Combination of LZ77 and adaptive Huffman coding. Best speed.

member.summary: Options for loading . Contains event raised on extraction.

member.name: E:Aspose.Zip.Bzip2.Bzip2LoadOptions.ExtractionProgressed
member.summary: Event raised invoked when some bytes have been extracted.
member.remarks: Event sender is the instance which extraction is progressed. The is the number of bytes after extraction.

example.code: Bzip2LoadOptions loadOptions = new Bzip2LoadOptions(); loadOptions.ExtractionProgressed += (s, e) => { percent = (int) ((double)(100 * e.ProceededBytes) / originalFileLength); };

member.name: E:Aspose.Zip.Bzip2.Bzip2SaveOptions.CompressionProgressed
member.summary: Raises when a portion of raw stream compressed.
member.remarks: This event won't be raised when compressing in multithreaded mode.

example.code: settings.CompressionProgressed += (s, e) => { int percent = (int)((100 * e.ProceededBytes) / entrySourceStream.Length); };

member.name: T:Aspose.Zip.ComHelper
member.summary: Provides methods for COM clients to load archives into Aspose.Zip.
member.remarks: Use the ComHelper class to load an archive from a file or stream. Particular classes provide a default constructor to create a new archive and also provides overloaded constructors to load an archive from a file or stream. If you are using Aspose.Zip from a .NET application, you can use all the archive constructors directly, but if you are using Aspose.Zip from a COM application, only the default archive constructor is available.

member.summary: Settings for LZMA compression method.

See more: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LempelZivMarkov_chain_algorithm

member.name: F:Aspose.Zip.Saving.ParallelCompressionMode.Never
member.summary: Do not compress in parallel.

member.name: F:Aspose.Zip.Saving.ParallelCompressionMode.Always
member.summary: Do compress in parallel. Beware of a drain on memory.

member.name: F:Aspose.Zip.Saving.ParallelCompressionMode.Auto
member.summary: Decide whether parallel compression will be used based on the entries. This option may compress in parallel some entries only.

member.name: T:Aspose.Zip.Saving.ParallelOptions
member.summary: Options for parallel compression.
member.remarks: These options manage simultaneous compression by several CPU cores.

member.name: P:Aspose.Zip.Saving.ParallelOptions.ParallelCompressInMemory
member.summary: Gets or sets value indicating how parallel approach to be used.

member.name: P:Aspose.Zip.Saving.ParallelOptions.AvailableMemorySize
member.summary: Gets or sets memory estimate in megabytes available to accomodate compressed entries without a swap to disk. This value only makes sense if setting is in mode.
member.remarks: This value is used to calculate the biggest size of entry that can be compressed in parallel with others. All entries above the calculated threshold will be compressed sequentially. It is safe to have property as big as free RAM and even bigger. By default, it is assumed you have at least 200MB per CPU core.

member.name: T:Aspose.Zip.Saving.PPMdCompressionSettings
member.summary: Settings for PPMd compression method.

remarks.para: PPMd is a data compression algorithm developed by Dmitry Shkarin. This algorithm is based on predictive phrase matching on multiple order contexts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Zip.Saving.PPMdCompressionSettings.ModelOrder
member.summary: Gets the order of the model.

member.name: P:Aspose.Zip.Saving.PPMdCompressionSettings.SuballocatorSize
member.summary: Gets the sub-allocator size in MB.

member.name: M:Aspose.Zip.Saving.PPMdCompressionSettings.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Order of the model.
Memory size in MB suballocator may consume.

remarks.para: Bigger model orders almost surely results in better compression and surely more memory and CPU usage.
The PPMd algorithm might need a lot of memory, especially when used on large files and/or used with large model order. If ppmd needs more memory than you give it, the compression will be worse.

member.exception: is not between 2 and 16. - or - is not between 1 and 256.

member.remarks: The default model order is 8, and the sub-allocator size is 50MB.

member.name: T:Aspose.Zip.Saving.SevenZipLZMACompressionSettings
member.summary: Settings for LZMA compression method within 7z archive.

remarks.para: The LempelZivMarkov chain algorithm (LZMA) is an algorithm used to perform lossless data compression. This algorithm uses a dictionary compression scheme somewhat similar to the LZ77 algorithm and features a high compression ratio and a variable compression-dictionary size.
See more: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LempelZivMarkov_chain_algorithm

member.name: P:Aspose.Zip.Saving.SevenZipLZMACompressionSettings.Method
member.summary: Gets compression or decompression method.

member.name: P:Aspose.Zip.Saving.SevenZipLZMACompressionSettings.DictionarySize
member.summary: Dictionary (history buffer) size indicates how many bytes of the recently processed uncompressed data is kept in memory. If not set, will be chosen accordingly to entry size.
member.remarks: The bigger the dictionary, usually the better the compression ratio is - but dictionaries larger than the uncompressed data are a waste of RAM.

member.name: M:Aspose.Zip.Tar.TarArchive.FromGZip(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary:
Extracts supplied gzip archive and composes from extracted data.
Important: gzip archive is fully extracted within this method, its content is kept internally. Beware of memory consumption.
member.param: The source of the archive.
member.remarks: GZip extraction stream is not seekable by the nature of compression algorithm. Tar archive provides facility to extract arbitrary record, so it has to operate seekable stream under the hood.
member.exception: The archive is corrupted.

member.summary: Create a single entry within the archive.

The metadata of file to be compressed.
True, if open the file immediately, otherwise open the file on archive saving.

member.name: T:Aspose.Zip.Xar.XarLoadOptions
member.summary: Options with which XAR archive is loaded from a compressed file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Zip.Xar.XarLoadOptions.EntryExtractionProgressed
member.summary: Gets or sets the delegate invoked when some bytes have been extracted.
member.remarks: Event sender is the instance which extraction is progressed.

example.code: XarArchive archive = new XarArchive("archive.xar", new XarLoadOptions() { EntryExtractionProgressed = (s, e) => { int percent = (int)((100 * e.ProceededBytes) / ((XarFileEntry)s).Length); } })

member.name: T:Aspose.Zip.LZMA.LzmaArchiveSettings
member.summary: Settings for lzma archive.

remarks.para: The LempelZivMarkov chain algorithm (LZMA) is an algorithm used to perform lossless data compression. This algorithm uses a dictionary compression scheme somewhat similar to the LZ77 algorithm and features a high compression ratio and a variable compression-dictionary size.
See more: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LempelZivMarkov_chain_algorithm

member.name: M:Aspose.Zip.LZMA.LzmaArchiveSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with default dictionary size, equals to 16 megabytes.

member.name: E:Aspose.Zip.LZMA.LzmaArchiveSettings.CompressionProgressed
member.summary: Raises when a portion of raw stream compressed.

example.code: lzmaArchiveSettings.CompressionProgressed += (s, e) => { int percent = (int)((100 * (long)e.ProceededBytes) / entrySourceStream.Length); };

member.name: P:Aspose.Zip.LZMA.LzmaArchiveSettings.DictionarySize
member.summary: Dictionary (history buffer) size indicates how many bytes of the recently processed uncompressed data are kept in memory. If not set, will be chosen accordingly to entry size.
member.remarks: The bigger the dictionary, usually the better the compression ratio is - but dictionaries larger than the uncompressed data are a waste of RAM.

However, if metered fails to upload consumption data during 24 hours period, the license will be set to evaluation status. member.name: E:Aspose.Zip.ArchiveEntry.CompressionProgressed
member.summary: Raises when a portion of raw stream compressed.
member.remarks: Event sender is an instance.

example.code: archive.Entries[0].CompressionProgressed += (s, e) => { int percent = (int)((100 * (long)e.ProceededBytes) / entrySourceStream.Length); };

member.name: E:Aspose.Zip.ArchiveEntry.ExtractionProgressed
member.summary: Raises when a portion of raw stream extracted.
member.remarks: Event sender is an instance. It is possible to cancel extraction.
member.example:
In this sample event handler is used for calculation the share of proceeded size in percents.
a.Entries[0].ExtractionProgressed += (s, e) => { int percent = (int)((100 * e.ProceededBytes) / ((ArchiveEntry)s).UncompressedSize); };

In this sample event handler is used for cancellation after the first hundred of Mb of entry was extracted.
a.Entries[0].ExtractionProgressed += (s, e) => { if (e.ProceededBytes > 100000000) e.Cancel = true; };
